original: zhes pa la mtha' bzhi dang bral ba'i don ni chos kyi don no //
analyzed: zhes pa la mtha' bzhi dang bral ba'i don ni chos kyi don no //
translated: The meaning of the Dharma is the meaning free from the four extremes.

original: dam pa'i don zhes pa ni rnam grangs dang bral ba'i don dam pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i don zhes pa ni rnam grangs dang bral ba'i don dam pa'o //
translated: The ultimate meaning is the ultimate meaning free from enumeration.

original: 'jigs pa med ces pa ni 'khor ba'i skyon gyis ma gos pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med ces pa ni 'khor ba'i skyon gyis ma gos pa'o //
translated: The line free from fear means that he is unstained by the faults of cyclic existence.

original: rnam rig sna tshogs zhes pa ni gdul bya thams cad kyi rgyud mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: rnam rig sna tshogs zhes pa ni gdul bya thams cad kyi rgyud mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The line various consciousnesses means that he knows the mind-streams of all those to be trained.

original: gzugs don zhes pa ni gang dang gang gis 'dul ba la de dang de'i gzugs su sprul nas 'dul ba'o //üîΩrnam shes sna tshogs rgyud dang ldan //
analyzed: gzugs don zhes pa ni gang dang gang gis 'dul ba la de dang de'i gzugs su sprul nas 'dul ba'o // rnam shes sna tshogs rgyud dang ldan //
translated: The line forms and objects means that he trains by emanating in whatever forms are necessary to train whomever needs training.

original: zhes pa ni sems can tha dad kyi sems kyi rgyud mkhyen cing mkhyen pa tsam du yang ma zad de /üîΩdngos don ma lus rnams la dga' //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems can tha dad kyi sems kyi rgyud mkhyen cing mkhyen pa tsam du yang ma zad de / dngos don ma lus rnams la dga' //
translated: The line various consciousnesses and their continua means that he knows the mind-streams of the various sentient beings.

original: zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi don 'ba' zhig ston to zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩstong pa nyid la dga' zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi don 'ba' zhig ston to zhes bya ba'i don to // stong pa nyid la dga' zhes pa ni /
translated: The line he delights in all things means that he teaches only the meaning of emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid la dga' ba'i gang zag la 'dod chags blo zhes pa ste snying rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la dga' ba'i gang zag la 'dod chags blo zhes pa ste snying rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The line he delights in emptiness means that he has the mind of desire, that is, he has great compassion.

original: 'o na snying rjes 'dod chags dang ma bral bas 'khor bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na snying rjes 'dod chags dang ma bral bas 'khor bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, But if he is not free from desire due to compassion, he will remain in cyclic existence,

original: srid pa'i 'dod chags la sogs 'das //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'dod chags la sogs 'das //
translated: He has transcended the attachments of existence, etc.

original: zhes pa ste 'dod chags rang rgyud pa spangs pa'o//
analyzed: zhes pa ste 'dod chags rang rgyud pa spangs pa'o//
translated: This means that he has abandoned the innate attachments.

original: srid gsum zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi srid pa'o //
analyzed: srid gsum zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi srid pa'o //
translated: The three existences are the existence of the desire realm, the existence of the form realm, and the existence of the formless realm.

original: dga' ba chen po pa zhes bya ba ni de dag mgu bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po pa zhes bya ba ni de dag mgu bar byed pa'o //
translated: He is the one who delights in great joy, because he delights in those.

original: sprin dkar dag pa bzhin du dkar //üîΩ'od bzang ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od //
analyzed: sprin dkar dag pa bzhin du dkar // 'od bzang ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od //
translated: He is white like a pure white cloud.üîΩHe is well-illuminated, with the light of an autumn moon.

original: nyi ma 'char ka'i dkyil ltar mdzes //
analyzed: nyi ma 'char ka'i dkyil ltar mdzes //
translated: He is beautiful like the orb of the rising sun.

original: @191b zhes pa ni / skyon gyis ma gos pa'i dpe bstan pa'o //
analyzed: @191b zhes pa ni / skyon gyis ma gos pa'i dpe bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows the example of being unstained by faults.

original: sen mo'i 'od ni shas cher dmar //üîΩchod pan bzang po mthon ka'i rtse //
analyzed: sen mo'i 'od ni shas cher dmar // chod pan bzang po mthon ka'i rtse //
translated: The light of his nails is very red.üîΩHe has an excellent crown protrusion.

original: skra mchog mthon ka chen po can //
analyzed: skra mchog mthon ka chen po can //
translated: He has the best hair, like great sapphire.

original: zhes pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: This praises him from the point of view of his major and minor marks.

original: nor bu chen po 'od chags dpal //
analyzed: nor bu chen po 'od chags dpal //
translated: He is the glory of the light of the great jewel.

original: zhes pa ni dpe'i sgo nas bstod pa'o ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni dpe'i sgo nas bstod pa'o ;
translated: This praises him from the point of view of examples.

original: / sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyan dang ldan //
analyzed: / sangs rgyas sprul pa'i rgyan dang ldan //
translated: He is adorned with the ornaments of the emanations of the buddhas.

original: zhes pa ni gling bzhi bye ba phrag brgyar sprul ba'i skur ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gling bzhi bye ba phrag brgyar sprul ba'i skur ston pa'o //
translated: This shows the emanation body in a billion four-continent worlds.

original: 'jig rten khams brgya kun bskyod pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten khams brgya kun bskyod pa //
translated: Shaking a hundred world systems

original: zhes pa ni 'khor ba las skyod par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'khor ba las skyod par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means that he causes them to move out of cyclic existence.

original: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i stobs chen ldan //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa'i stobs chen ldan //
translated: Possessing the great power of the bases of miraculous powers

original: zhes pa ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mos pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o //
translated: means that he benefits migrating beings by means of the four bases of miraculous powers, such as the concentration of aspiration.

original: de nyid ces pa ni ye shes sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces pa ni ye shes sems dpa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúsuchness‚Äù is the wisdom being.

original: dran pa chen po 'chang zhes pa ni ye shes rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa chen po 'chang zhes pa ni ye shes rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúgreat mindfulness holder‚Äù is endowed with the five types of wisdom.

original: dran pa bzhi po zhes pa ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa bzhi po zhes pa ni lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar gzhag ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúfour mindfulnesses‚Äù are the application of mindfulness to the body, the application of mindfulness to the mind, the application of mindfulness to feelings, and the application of mindfulness to phenomena.

original: ting 'dzin rgyal zhes pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ting 'dzin rgyal zhes pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The ‚Äúconcentration king‚Äù is the vajra-like concentration.

original: byang chub yan lag ces pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun te dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub yan lag ces pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag bdun te dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúbranches of enlightenment‚Äù are the seven branches of enlightenment, beginning with the correct mindfulness of enlightenment.

original: me tog ces pa ni mdzes pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: me tog ces pa ni mdzes pa'i don gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúFlowers‚Äù means beautiful.

original: spos zhes pa ni yid tshim par byed pa'o //
analyzed: spos zhes pa ni yid tshim par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIncense‚Äù means pleasing to the mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan mtsho //
translated: ‚ÄúThe ocean of the qualities of the TathƒÅgatas‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: means endowed with the powers, fearlessnesses, and unique qualities of a Buddha.

original: lam gyi yan lag brgyad tshul rig / ces pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad de yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag brgyad tshul rig / ces pa ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad de yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa dang /
translated: ‚ÄúKnowing the eightfold path‚Äù means the eightfold noble path, which is correct view, correct thought, correct speech, correct action, correct livelihood, correct effort, correct mindfulness, and

original: ting nge 'dzin dang brgyad do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang brgyad do //
translated: correct meditative stabilization.

original: rig ces pa ni thugs su chud pa'i don to //
analyzed: rig ces pa ni thugs su chud pa'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúKnowing‚Äù means the meaning of realization.

original: yang dag sangs rgyas lam rig pa //
analyzed: yang dag sangs rgyas lam rig pa //
translated: ‚ÄúKnowing the path of perfect Buddhahood‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni don phyin ci ma log par rang gi thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni don phyin ci ma log par rang gi thugs su chud nas /
translated: Having understood the meaning without error,

original: sems can kun la shas cher chags //
analyzed: sems can kun la shas cher chags //
translated: he is greatly attached to all sentient beings.

original: zhes pa ste 'gro ba la ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste 'gro ba la ston pa'o //
translated: This is teaching for transmigrating beings.

original: nam mkha' lta bur chags pa med //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur chags pa med //
translated: He is unattached like space.

original: ces pa ni 'gro ba'i don byed kyang skyon gyis ma gos pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni 'gro ba'i don byed kyang skyon gyis ma gos pa'o //
translated: This is that, although he acts for the welfare of transmigrating beings, he is not sullied by faults.

original: sems can kun gyi @192a * //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi @192a * //
translated: He enters the minds of all sentient beings.

original: yid la 'jug / ces pa ni 'gro ba dang mthun pa'i sku ston pa'o //
analyzed: yid la 'jug / ces pa ni 'gro ba dang mthun pa'i sku ston pa'o //
translated: This is that he displays a body in accordance with transmigrating beings.

original: sems can kun gyi yid ltar mgyogs //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid ltar mgyogs //
translated: He is as swift as the mind of all sentient beings.

original: zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i don la myur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i don la myur ba'o //
translated: This is that he is quick to act for the welfare of transmigrating beings.

original: sems can kun gyi dbang don shes //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi dbang don shes //
translated: He knows the faculties and aims of all sentient beings.

original: zhes pa ni gdul bya'i rgyud dang dbang po'i bye brag mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gdul bya'i rgyud dang dbang po'i bye brag mkhyen pa'o //
translated: This is that he knows the distinctions of the continua and faculties of those to be tamed.

original: sems can kun gyi yid 'phrog pa //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid 'phrog pa //
translated: He captivates the minds of all sentient beings.

original: zhes pa ni gdul bya'i yid 'brid par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gdul bya'i yid 'brid par byed pa'o //
translated: This is that he seduces the minds of those to be tamed.

original: phung po lnga zhes pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang lnga'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga zhes pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang lnga'o //
translated: The five aggregates are the five aggregates of form, feeling, discrimination, compositional factors, and consciousness.

original: de nyid shes zhes pa ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid shes zhes pa ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The phrase he knows reality means that he knows impermanence, suffering, and no-self.

original: rnam dag phung po lnga 'chang ba //
analyzed: rnam dag phung po lnga 'chang ba //
translated: He holds the five pure aggregates.

original: zhes pa ni zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This means that he possesses the five pure aggregates.

original: nges 'byung kun gyi mtha' la gnas //
analyzed: nges 'byung kun gyi mtha' la gnas //
translated: He abides at the end of all the paths to liberation.

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin brnyes pa'o //
translated: This means that he has attained the vajra-like concentration.

original: nges par 'byung ba kun la mkhas //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba kun la mkhas //
translated: He is skilled in all the paths to liberation.

original: zhes pa ni lam mtha' dag mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lam mtha' dag mkhyen pa'o //
translated: This means that he knows all the paths.

original: nges 'byung kun gyi lam la gnas //
analyzed: nges 'byung kun gyi lam la gnas //
translated: He abides on the path of all the paths to liberation.

original: zhes pa ni rang gis spyad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang gis spyad pa'o //
translated: This means that he practices them himself.

original: nges par 'byung ba kun ston pa //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba kun ston pa //
translated: He teaches all the paths to liberation.

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i lam de gzhan la ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i lam de gzhan la ston pa'o //
translated: This means that he teaches others the paths that he has practiced.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis zhes pa ni rten 'brel bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis zhes pa ni rten 'brel bcu gnyis so //
translated: The phrase the twelve limbs refers to the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: srid rtsa bton zhes pa ni ma rig pa dag par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: srid rtsa bton zhes pa ni ma rig pa dag par byed pa'o ;
translated: The phrase he has pulled out the root of existence means that he has purified ignorance.

original: / dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan //
analyzed: / dag pa rnam pa bcu gnyis ldan //
translated: He possesses the twelve pure aspects.

original: zhes pa ni rten 'brel bcu gnyis dag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rten 'brel bcu gnyis dag pa'o //
translated: This means that he has purified the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: bden bzhi'i tshul gyi rnam pa can //
analyzed: bden bzhi'i tshul gyi rnam pa can //
translated: It has the aspects of the four noble truths.

original: zhes pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa dag thugs su chud pa'o//
analyzed: zhes pa ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa dag thugs su chud pa'o//
translated: This means that it has realized the truth of suffering, the truth of the origin of suffering, the truth of the cessation of suffering, and the truth of the path.

original: shes pa brgyad po rtogs pa 'chang //
analyzed: shes pa brgyad po rtogs pa 'chang //
translated: It is the bearer of the realization of the eight kinds of knowledge.

original: zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: This means that it is the purification of the eight collections of consciousness.

original: bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang //
analyzed: bden don rnam pa bcu gnyis 'chang //
translated: It is the bearer of the twelve aspects of the meaning of the truths.

original: zhes pa ni bden pa bzhi rnam pa bcu gnyis tshul du mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bden pa bzhi rnam pa bcu gnyis tshul du mkhyen pa'o //
translated: This means that it knows the four noble truths in their twelve aspects.üîΩIt is the knower of the sixteen kinds of reality.

original: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig / ces pa ni stong pa nyid bcu drug gi don thugs su chud pa'o ;
analyzed: de nyid rnam pa bcu drug rig / ces pa ni stong pa nyid bcu drug gi don thugs su chud pa'o ;
translated: This means that it has realized the meaning of the sixteen kinds of emptiness.

original: / rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa //
analyzed: / rnam pa nyi shus byang chub pa //
translated: It is the enlightenment through the twenty aspects.

original: zhes pa ni phung po lnga po re re la yang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa bzhi bzhi ste nyi shu'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phung po lnga po re re la yang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa bzhi bzhi ste nyi shu'o //
translated: This means that each of the five aggregates has four aspects: impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: rnam pa sangs rgyas kun rig mchog / ces pa ni 'khor 'das kyi chos thams cad khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sangs rgyas kun rig mchog / ces pa ni 'khor 'das kyi chos thams cad khong du chud pa'o //
translated: The form is the supreme omniscience of all the Buddhas.üîΩThis means that he has comprehended all the phenomena of cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: sangs rgyas @192b kun gyi sprul pa'i sku //
analyzed: sangs rgyas @192b kun gyi sprul pa'i sku //
translated: He is the emanation body of all the Buddhas.

original: bye ba dpag med 'gyed pa po //
analyzed: bye ba dpag med 'gyed pa po //
translated: He is the one who sends out countless millions of emanations.

original: zhes pa ni lha rkyang ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang / khro bo dang zhi ba'i sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gang dang gang mos pa la de dang de'i sku ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lha rkyang ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang / khro bo dang zhi ba'i sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gang dang gang mos pa la de dang de'i sku ston pa'o //
translated: This means that he displays inconceivable bodies, wrathful and peaceful, as a single deity or as a mandala circle, and he displays himself in whatever form is desired.

original: skad cig thams cad mngon par rtogs //
analyzed: skad cig thams cad mngon par rtogs //
translated: He realizes all things in every instant.

original: zhes pa ni chos nyid kyi don dus kyi mtha' skad cig gis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos nyid kyi don dus kyi mtha' skad cig gis rtogs pa'o //
translated: This means that he realizes the meaning of reality in an instant of time.üîΩHe knows the meaning of all things in an instant of mind.

original: sems kyi skad cig don kun rig / ces pa ni sems can thams cad kyi rgyud thams cad skad cig gis khong du chud pa'o //üîΩtheg pa sna tshogs thabs tshul gyis //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig don kun rig / ces pa ni sems can thams cad kyi rgyud thams cad skad cig gis khong du chud pa'o // theg pa sna tshogs thabs tshul gyis //
translated: This means that he comprehends in an instant of time the mind streams of all sentient beings.

original: 'gro ba'i don la rtogs pa po //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don la rtogs pa po //
translated: He is the one who knows the meaning of beings through the methods of the various vehicles.üîΩThis means that he knows the meaning of beings through the methods of the various vehicles.

original: zhes pa ni theg pa sna tshogs zhes pa ni theg pa'i sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa la bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni theg pa sna tshogs zhes pa ni theg pa'i sgo bsam gyis mi khyab pa la bya ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúvarious vehicles‚Äù refers to the inconceivable number of vehicles.üîΩIf we divide them extensively, there are eighty-four thousand; if we divide them in an intermediate way, there are the twelve branches of excellent speech; if we divide them in a brief way, there are the three scriptural collections; and if we divide them in a very brief way, there are the three vehicles.

original: rgyas par dbye na brgyad khri bzhi stong dang / 'bring du dbye na gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis dang / bstun sde snod gsum dang / theg pa rnam pa gsum dang / khyad par bla na med pa'i theg pa dang / mu stegs kyi theg pa yan chad 'dir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par dbye na brgyad khri bzhi stong dang / 'bring du dbye na gsung rab yan lag bcu gnyis dang / bstun sde snod gsum dang / theg pa rnam pa gsum dang / khyad par bla na med pa'i theg pa dang / mu stegs kyi theg pa yan chad 'dir shes par bya'o //
translated: In particular, the vehicle of the tƒ´rthikas should be understood here.

original: de la mu stegs kyi lta ba la gnyis te /
analyzed: de la mu stegs kyi lta ba la gnyis te /
translated: There are two views of the tƒ´rthikas:

original: chad par lta ba dang rtag par lta ba'o //
analyzed: chad par lta ba dang rtag par lta ba'o //
translated: the view of annihilation and the view of permanence.

original: de la 'dir slob dpon gyi mdo sde mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su 'brangs te /
analyzed: de la 'dir slob dpon gyi mdo sde mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su 'brangs te /
translated: Here, the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna follows the S≈´tra on the Ten Grounds and the S≈´tra on the Ten Grounds and the S≈´tra on the Recollection of the Three Jewels and refutes the tƒ´rthikas‚Äô view of a self.

original: rang bzhin gyis bdag dgag par bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bdag dgag par bya ste /
translated: He refutes the tƒ´rthikas‚Äô view of a self that is a thing.

original: ston pa gzegs zan pa dag bdag dngos po don dam par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: ston pa gzegs zan pa dag bdag dngos po don dam par 'dod pa ste /
translated: The teacher Ka·πáƒÅda asserts a self that is a thing ultimately.

original: 'dus byas sam 'on te 'dus ma byas yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus byas sam 'on te 'dus ma byas yin zhe na /
translated: Is it conditioned or unconditioned?

original: 'dus byas yin na mi rtag par 'gyur la 'dus ma byas yin na dngos po nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas yin na mi rtag par 'gyur la 'dus ma byas yin na dngos po nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is conditioned, it is impermanent. If it is unconditioned, it is a non-entity.

original: gtan tshigs lhag pa gzhan yang ston pa ser skya'i bdag rtag pa de dngos po zhig gam /
analyzed: gtan tshigs lhag pa gzhan yang ston pa ser skya'i bdag rtag pa de dngos po zhig gam /
translated: Another additional reason: Is the self of the teacher Kapila permanent or impermanent?

original: 'on te dngos med zhig kho bos dpyad par bya'o //üîΩgal te dngos med do zhe na /üîΩ'o na bdag rtag pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te dngos med zhig kho bos dpyad par bya'o // gal te dngos med do zhe na / 'o na bdag rtag pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: We will examine this.üîΩIf it is impermanent, his doctrine is undermined.

original: gal te yang dngos po'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang dngos po'o zhe na /
translated: If it is permanent, is the permanent self a thing or a non-thing?üîΩIf it is a non-thing, the permanent self is undermined.

original: 'o na bdag rtag pa des don byed par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhe na /üîΩgal te don byed par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bdag rtag pa des don byed par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhe na / gal te don byed par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is a thing, does the permanent self perform a function or not?

original: gang don byed par mi nus pa de ni nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra'o //üîΩgzhan yang don byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang don byed par mi nus pa de ni nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra'o // gzhan yang don byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it does not perform a function, it is like a sky flower.

original: rim gyis byed dam cig car don byed /
analyzed: rim gyis byed dam cig car don byed /
translated: If it does perform a function, does it perform a function gradually or instantaneously?

original: rim gyis don byed na ni mi rtag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rim gyis don byed na ni mi rtag par 'gyur la /
translated: If it performs a function gradually, it is impermanent.

original: cig car don byed na nus pa chung ngu dag gis kyang dpa' bo'i bya ba byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car don byed na nus pa chung ngu dag gis kyang dpa' bo'i bya ba byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it performs a function instantaneously, even those of little ability would perform the deeds of heroes.

original: chad par lta @193a * //
analyzed: chad par lta @193a * //
translated: The view of annihilation.üîΩüîΩ

original: ba dag kyang rigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba dag kyang rigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The view of annihilation is also unreasonable.

original: chad nas 'byung bar 'gyur phyir dang // snga phyi slu ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: chad nas 'byung bar 'gyur phyir dang // snga phyi slu ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of arising from annihilation and because of the non-deceptiveness of prior and subsequent,

original: chad pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chad pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gyur te /
translated: it is not of the nature of annihilation.

original: de bas na phyi ba dag rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na phyi ba dag rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the externalists are unreasonable.

original: nang pa dag la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: nang pa dag la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The internalists have three types:

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'o //
translated: the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas, and the vehicle of the bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa ni gang zag gi bdag dri ma spangs nas chos kyi bdag gzung 'dzin don dam par 'dod de /üîΩde la phyi rol gyi yul 'di rdul phra rab zlum sgo nga cha med pa mang po 'dus pa las /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa ni gang zag gi bdag dri ma spangs nas chos kyi bdag gzung 'dzin don dam par 'dod de / de la phyi rol gyi yul 'di rdul phra rab zlum sgo nga cha med pa mang po 'dus pa las /
translated: The vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas is as follows: Having abandoned the stains of the self of persons, they assert the self of phenomena, subject and object, to be ultimate.

original: gong bu rags pa grub par 'dod de /
analyzed: gong bu rags pa grub par 'dod de /
translated: In that regard, they assert that these external objects are established as gross wholes from the aggregation of many partless subtle particles that are round like eggs.

original: de dag kyang byis pa'i ngang tshul can du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang byis pa'i ngang tshul can du shes par bya ste /
translated: Those should be understood to be childish ways.

original: rdul phra rab de dag 'byar ba dang bskor ba'am /
analyzed: rdul phra rab de dag 'byar ba dang bskor ba'am /
translated: Those subtle particles are either joined or surrounded.

original: bar med par gnas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: bar med par gnas kyang rung ste /
translated: It may be that [the particle] abides without interstice,

original: phyogs cha drug gis rnam par phye na /
analyzed: phyogs cha drug gis rnam par phye na /
translated: but if it is divided into six parts,

original: rdul phra rab gcig kyang mi 'grub la /
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig kyang mi 'grub la /
translated: even a single subtle particle is not established.

original: gang gcig ma grub pa des ni du ma yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gcig ma grub pa des ni du ma yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And if the one is not established, the many will not be established either.

original: de ltar gcig dang du ma ma grub na phyi rol gyi don yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gcig dang du ma ma grub na phyi rol gyi don yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the one and the many are not established in this way, external objects will also be non-existent.

original: rang rgyal ni /
analyzed: rang rgyal ni /
translated: The Pratyekabuddhayana

original: phyi rol gyi don la gcig dang du mas gnod pas gtan med la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la gcig dang du mas gnod pas gtan med la /
translated: [holds that] external objects are utterly non-existent, since they are invalidated by the one and the many.

original: nang 'dzin pa rig pa don dam par 'dod do //
analyzed: nang 'dzin pa rig pa don dam par 'dod do //
translated: [It holds that] the inner apprehender, the awareness, is ultimate.

original: de dag kyang bden par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang bden par mi 'gyur te /
translated: But even that is not true,

original: yul ma grub pa'i yul du 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni nam yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul ma grub pa'i yul du 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni nam yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: for it is never logical that a consciousness apprehends an object that is not established.

original: dper na dkar po ma grub par dkar por 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni skye me srid de /
analyzed: dper na dkar po ma grub par dkar por 'dzin pa'i shes pa ni skye me srid de /
translated: For example, a consciousness that apprehends something as white is not possible if whiteness is not established.

original: skyes bu lha spyin la gang dag dbyug pa yod na des khyad par du byas pa'i dbyug pa can zhes 'dogs par rigs la /
analyzed: skyes bu lha spyin la gang dag dbyug pa yod na des khyad par du byas pa'i dbyug pa can zhes 'dogs par rigs la /
translated: If Devadatta has a stick, it is logical to designate him as ‚Äúthe one with a stick,‚Äù qualifying him with the stick.

original: gang dag dbyug pa med na lha spyin dbyug pa can zhes mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang dag dbyug pa med na lha spyin dbyug pa can zhes mi rigs so //
translated: If there is no stick, it is not tenable to say that Devadatta is a stick-holder.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la gnyis te /
translated: The Bodhisattva Vehicle is twofold:

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa dang / dbu ma pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa dang / dbu ma pa'o //
translated: YogƒÅcƒÅra and Madhyamaka.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa la gnyis te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa la gnyis te /
translated: YogƒÅcƒÅra is twofold:

original: rnam bden pa dang / rnam brdzun pa'o //
analyzed: rnam bden pa dang / rnam brdzun pa'o //
translated: True Aspectarians and False Aspectarians.

original: de la rnam bden pa'i lugs kyis dkar dmar gyi rnam pa sna tshogs 'di shes pa'i rnam par bden par 'dod de /
analyzed: de la rnam bden pa'i lugs kyis dkar dmar gyi rnam pa sna tshogs 'di shes pa'i rnam par bden par 'dod de /
translated: According to the True Aspectarian system, the various aspects of white and red are asserted to be real aspects of consciousness.

original: gang zag dang chos kyi bdag dang bral ba'i shes pa don dam par 'dod de /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos kyi bdag dang bral ba'i shes pa don dam par 'dod de /
translated: Consciousness, which is devoid of the self of persons and phenomena, is asserted to be ultimate.

original: de nyid la yang dbye na gnyis te /
analyzed: de nyid la yang dbye na gnyis te /
translated: If one divides that, there are two:

original: sna tshogs su snang yang shes pa gcig gi ngo bor bden par 'dod pa dang / snang yang du mar snang la bden yang du mar @193b bden par 'dod pa dang gnyis so //
analyzed: sna tshogs su snang yang shes pa gcig gi ngo bor bden par 'dod pa dang / snang yang du mar snang la bden yang du mar @193b bden par 'dod pa dang gnyis so //
translated: those who assert that although there are various appearances, they are real in being the entity of a single consciousness and those who assert that although there are appearances, they are real in being multiple.

original: dang po yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dang po yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The first is not reasonable.

original: gal te yul dang shes pa gnyis //
analyzed: gal te yul dang shes pa gnyis //
translated: Are objects and consciousnesses

original: gcig gam 'on te tha dad yin //
analyzed: gcig gam 'on te tha dad yin //
translated: the same or different?

original: gal te gcig pa yin 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te gcig pa yin 'gyur na //
translated: If they were the same,

original: rnam pa du mar yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam pa du mar yod pa'i phyir //
translated: because of existing in many aspects,

original: shes pa'ang du mar thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: shes pa'ang du mar thal bar 'gyur //
translated: consciousness would also be multiple.

original: yul dang shes pa tha dad na //
analyzed: yul dang shes pa tha dad na //
translated: If objects and consciousnesses were different,

original: nyan thos dag tu cis mi 'gro //
analyzed: nyan thos dag tu cis mi 'gro //
translated: why would they not go to the ≈õrƒÅvakas‚Äô view?

original: gnyis pa'ang rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: gnyis pa'ang rigs pa ma yin te //
translated: The second is also illogical,

original: yul la tshad mas gnod pa bzhin //
analyzed: yul la tshad mas gnod pa bzhin //
translated: because objects are undermined by valid knowledge.

original: rig pa dag la cis mi gnod //
analyzed: rig pa dag la cis mi gnod //
translated: Why would consciousness not be undermined?

original: gzhan yang rnam pa'i 'khor lo 'di //üîΩ'khrul pa'i shes pas gzung ba'am //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa'i 'khor lo 'di // 'khrul pa'i shes pas gzung ba'am //
translated: Moreover, this wheel of aspectsüîΩis apprehended by a mistaken consciousness

original: 'on te ma 'khrul ba yis gzung //
analyzed: 'on te ma 'khrul ba yis gzung //
translated: or is it apprehended by a nonmistaken one?

original: gal te 'khrul pas gzung 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pas gzung 'gyur na //
translated: If it were apprehended by a mistaken [consciousness],

original: rnam bden pa yi dam bca' bud //
analyzed: rnam bden pa yi dam bca' bud //
translated: abandon the Proponents of Real Images‚Äô thesis.

original: ma 'khrul pa yis gzung 'gyur na //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa yis gzung 'gyur na //
translated: If it were apprehended by a nonmistaken [consciousness],

original: kun gyis bden pa mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: kun gyis bden pa mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: everyone would see the truth.

original: rnam par brdzun pa'i 'dod pa yang //
analyzed: rnam par brdzun pa'i 'dod pa yang //
translated: The Proponents of False Images‚Äô assertion

original: rnam pa gnyis su shes bya ste //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su shes bya ste //
translated: should be understood to be twofold:üîΩthe consciousnesses of those who see only this side

original: tshu rol mthong ba'i rig pa dang // mya ngan 'das pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba'i rig pa dang // mya ngan 'das pa'i ye shes so //
translated: and the wisdom of those who have attained nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: mya ngan 'das pa'i ye shes la //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'i ye shes la //
translated: The wisdom of those who have attained nirvƒÅ·πáa

original: rnam pa gnyis su shes bya ste //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su shes bya ste //
translated: should be understood to be twofold:

original: dri byas rang rig dag pa'o //
analyzed: dri byas rang rig dag pa'o //
translated: And the pure self-awareness is the answer.

original: dri ma dang bcas lugs kyis ni //
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas lugs kyis ni //
translated: According to the system with stains,

original: rnam pa'i 'khor lo sna tshogs 'di //
analyzed: rnam pa'i 'khor lo sna tshogs 'di //
translated: This variegated wheel of features

original: mnyam gzhag ngo la mi snang ste //
analyzed: mnyam gzhag ngo la mi snang ste //
translated: Does not appear in the face of meditative equipoise,

original: rjes thob dag la snang bar 'dod //
analyzed: rjes thob dag la snang bar 'dod //
translated: But is asserted to appear in post-equipoise.

original: rang rig dag pa'i lugs kyis ni //
analyzed: rang rig dag pa'i lugs kyis ni //
translated: According to the system of pure self-awareness,

original: mthong lam skyes pa'i rjes thogs la //
analyzed: mthong lam skyes pa'i rjes thogs la //
translated: Immediately after the path of seeing arises,

original: rnam pa'i 'khor lo med par 'dod //
analyzed: rnam pa'i 'khor lo med par 'dod //
translated: The variegated wheel of features is asserted to be absent.

original: myong ba tsam gyis rig pa de //
analyzed: myong ba tsam gyis rig pa de //
translated: That awareness through mere experience

original: gang yang 'thad pa ma yin te //
analyzed: gang yang 'thad pa ma yin te //
translated: Is not tenable in any way.

original: gang yang rnam par rig pa pa //
analyzed: gang yang rnam par rig pa pa //
translated: And whatever is the cognizer

original: khyod kyi shes pa don dam de //
analyzed: khyod kyi shes pa don dam de //
translated: In your system, that consciousness is ultimate.

original: skyes nas yod dam ma skyes par //
analyzed: skyes nas yod dam ma skyes par //
translated: Is it existent after it has arisen or non-arisen?

original: gal te skyes nas yod pa na //
analyzed: gal te skyes nas yod pa na //
translated: If it is existent after it has arisen,

original: rang las skye'am gzhan las skye //
analyzed: rang las skye'am gzhan las skye //
translated: Does it arise from itself or from another?

original: gal te rang las skye zhe na //
analyzed: gal te rang las skye zhe na //
translated: If it is said to arise from itself,

original: rang nyid grub bam ma grub las //
analyzed: rang nyid grub bam ma grub las //

original: grub pa dag las skye mi dgos //
analyzed: grub pa dag las skye mi dgos //
translated: There is no need for it to arise from established bases.

original: ma grub pa la skye mi srid //
analyzed: ma grub pa la skye mi srid //
translated: It is impossible for it to arise from unestablished bases.

original: gal te gzhan las skye zhe na //
analyzed: gal te gzhan las skye zhe na //
translated: If it is said to arise from another,

original: rtag pa'am ni mi rtag pa //
analyzed: rtag pa'am ni mi rtag pa //

original: rtag pa dag las skye zhe na //
analyzed: rtag pa dag las skye zhe na //

analyzed: 'gyur med phyir na rgyur mi btub //

original: mi rtag pa las skye zhe na //
analyzed: mi rtag pa las skye zhe na //

original: mi rtag dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mi rtag dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir //
translated: Because impermanent things are included in time,

original: 'das dang ma 'ongs da ltar gsum //
analyzed: 'das dang ma 'ongs da ltar gsum //
translated: The three‚Äîpast, future, and present‚Äî

original: gang las skye ba dri bar bya //
analyzed: gang las skye ba dri bar bya //
translated: From which would it arise?

original: 'das dang ma 'ongs rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: 'das dang ma 'ongs rnam pa gnyis //
translated: Because the past and future are twofold,

original: med pa'i phyir na rgyur mi rung //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir na rgyur mi rung //
translated: They cannot be causes.

original: da ltar dag las skye zhe na //
analyzed: da ltar dag las skye zhe na //
translated: If you say that it arises from the present,

original: rgyu 'bras dus mnyam 'gyur ba'i phyir //üîΩbskyed bya @194a * //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras dus mnyam 'gyur ba'i phyir // bskyed bya @194a * //
translated: Because cause and effect would be simultaneous,üîΩIt would not be tenable that

original: skyed byed mi rigs te //üîΩskyes nas yod pa'i dam bca' nyams //
analyzed: skyed byed mi rigs te // skyes nas yod pa'i dam bca' nyams //
translated: The produced and the producer are different.

original: gal te ma skyes yod ce na //
analyzed: gal te ma skyes yod ce na //
translated: If you say that it exists after it has arisen,üîΩYour thesis is undermined.üîΩIf you say that it exists before it has arisen,

original: ma skyes yod pa mi srid de //
analyzed: ma skyes yod pa mi srid de //
translated: It is impossible for it to exist before it has arisen,

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin //
translated: Just like a sky flower.

original: des na gdon gyis zin pa yi //
analyzed: des na gdon gyis zin pa yi //
translated: Therefore, those who are possessed by demonsüîΩAnd assert that awareness is a thing

original: rig pa dngos por 'dod pa dag / thar pa'i ming yang mi srid de ;
analyzed: rig pa dngos por 'dod pa dag / thar pa'i ming yang mi srid de ;
translated: Do not even have the name of liberation;

original: / rang nyid phung bar byed du zad //
analyzed: / rang nyid phung bar byed du zad //
translated: They are simply bringing about their own ruin.

original: dbu ma la yang gnyis yod de //
analyzed: dbu ma la yang gnyis yod de //
translated: There are two types of Madhyamaka:

original: chos rnams sgyu mar smra ba dang // rab tu mi gnas smra ba'o //üîΩsgyu ma'i grub mtha' rigs min te //
analyzed: chos rnams sgyu mar smra ba dang // rab tu mi gnas smra ba'o // sgyu ma'i grub mtha' rigs min te //
translated: The tenets of the illusion-like are illogical.üîΩBecause the illusion is not established by valid cognition,

original: sgyu tshad mas ma grub dang // sgyu ma yin phyir bden pa min //
analyzed: sgyu tshad mas ma grub dang // sgyu ma yin phyir bden pa min //
translated: and because it is an illusion, it is not true.

original: des na sgyu ma nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: des na sgyu ma nyams par 'gyur //

original: rab tu mi gnas 'dod gzhung ni //
analyzed: rab tu mi gnas 'dod gzhung ni //
translated: The texts of the thoroughly non-abiding

original: rnam pa gnyis su shes bya ste //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su shes bya ste //
translated: should be known to be of two types:üîΩthe truth of the ultimate basic nature

original: don dam gshis kyi bden pa dang // kun rdzob dag gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: don dam gshis kyi bden pa dang // kun rdzob dag gi bden pa'o //
translated: and the truth of the relative.

original: don dam bden pa rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: don dam bden pa rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The ultimate truth is of two types:

original: rnam grangs dang ni rnam grangs min //
analyzed: rnam grangs dang ni rnam grangs min //
translated: the categorized and the uncategorized.

original: kun rdzob bden pa rnam gnyis te //
analyzed: kun rdzob bden pa rnam gnyis te //

original: yang dag pa dang log pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa dang log pa'o //

analyzed: 'di dag grub mtha' mchog yin te //

original: bla med gsang sngags theg pa yang //
analyzed: bla med gsang sngags theg pa yang //

original: de las gud na med phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gud na med phyir ro //
translated: is not separate from them.üîΩIf one thinks, ‚ÄúThen the vehicle of the perfections

original: 'o na pha rol phyin pa dang // gsang sngags theg pa khyad med dam //
analyzed: 'o na pha rol phyin pa dang // gsang sngags theg pa khyad med dam //
translated: and the vehicle of secret mantra are not different,‚Äù

original: snyam du sems dpa'i gang zag la //
analyzed: snyam du sems dpa'i gang zag la //
translated: to the person who thinks that way,

original: don la khyad par rdul tsam med //
analyzed: don la khyad par rdul tsam med //
translated: there is not even an atom‚Äôs difference in meaning.

original: thabs dang lam gyi bye brag la //
analyzed: thabs dang lam gyi bye brag la //
translated: The differences in the methods and paths

original: khyad par bsam gyis mi khyab ste //
analyzed: khyad par bsam gyis mi khyab ste //
translated: are inconceivable.

original: de skad du yang /üîΩdon gcig na yang ma rmongs dang // thabs mang dka' ba med pa dang // dbang po rnon po'i dbang byas pas //
analyzed: de skad du yang / don gcig na yang ma rmongs dang // thabs mang dka' ba med pa dang // dbang po rnon po'i dbang byas pas //
translated: And it is said:üîΩThe Mantra Vehicle is superiorüîΩbecause it is not confused about the one meaning,

original: sngags kyi theg pa khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: sngags kyi theg pa khyad par 'phags //
translated: has many methods, is not difficult,üîΩand is for those with sharp faculties.

original: zhes pa'o // de lta bu'i theg pa sna tshogs kyi sgo nas 'gro ba'i don byed pa po de yang ye shes sems dpa' khyod nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de lta bu'i theg pa sna tshogs kyi sgo nas 'gro ba'i don byed pa po de yang ye shes sems dpa' khyod nyid yin no //

analyzed: theg pa gsum ni zhes pa ni nyan thos dang / rang rgyal ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa'o //
translated: The three vehicles are the vehicles of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: nges 'byung la zhes pa ni /
analyzed: nges 'byung la zhes pa ni /
translated: As for ‚Äúthe renunciation,‚Äù

original: sa dang po'i bden pa tsam ni theg pa gsum gyis thob par smra la /
analyzed: sa dang po'i bden pa tsam ni theg pa gsum gyis thob par smra la /
translated: it is said that the mere truth of the first bh≈´mi is attained through the three vehicles.

original: mthar thug bcu gcig pa'i ye shes ni khyad par bla na med pa'i theg pa kho nas thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthar thug bcu gcig pa'i ye shes ni khyad par bla na med pa'i theg pa kho nas thob pa'i phyir /
translated: However, the ultimate wisdom of the eleventh bh≈´mi is attained only through the unsurpassed, special vehicle.

original: theg pa gcig gi 'bras bur gnas //
analyzed: theg pa gcig gi 'bras bur gnas //
translated: Therefore, it is the result of the one vehicle.

original: zhes pa'o // nyon mongs khams rnams dag pa'i bdag / ces pa ni 'khor ba'i 'bras bu dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // nyon mongs khams rnams dag pa'i bdag / ces pa ni 'khor ba'i 'bras bu dag par byed pa'o //
translated: The afflictive constituents are purified in the self.üîΩThis is the purification of the result of cyclic existence.üîΩThe constituents of karma are exhausted.

original: las kyi khams ni zad byed pa ni 'khor ba'i rgyu dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi khams ni zad byed pa ni 'khor ba'i rgyu dag par byed pa'o //
translated: This is the purification of the cause of cyclic existence.

original: chu bo rgya @194b mtsho kun las brgal //
analyzed: chu bo rgya @194b mtsho kun las brgal //
translated: One crosses over all the rivers and oceans.

original: zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo dang / bdag tu lta ba'i chu bo ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu bo dang / bdag tu lta ba'i chu bo ste /
translated: The rivers are the river of desire, the river of existence, the river of ignorance, and the river of the view of self.

original: de dag rgya mtsho dang 'dra zhing rgal dka' bas na rgya mtsho zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag rgya mtsho dang 'dra zhing rgal dka' bas na rgya mtsho zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called oceans because they are like oceans and difficult to cross.

original: kun las brgal zhes pa ni de dag kun las thar pa'o //
analyzed: kun las brgal zhes pa ni de dag kun las thar pa'o //
translated: One crosses over all of them is the liberation from all of them.

original: thabs gang gis rgal zhe na /
analyzed: thabs gang gis rgal zhe na /
translated: By what means does one cross over?

original: sbyor ba'i dgon pa zhes bya ba ste sbyor ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs zung du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dgon pa zhes bya ba ste sbyor ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs zung du 'jug pa'o //
translated: The forest of application is the union of the accumulations of merit and wisdom in the application.

original: dgon pa ni dgon pa zhes bya dben pa zhes bya stong pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dgon pa ni dgon pa zhes bya dben pa zhes bya stong pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The forest is called a forest, a solitude, and an emptiness.

original: de ltar tshogs gnyis dang stong pa nyid bsgoms pa las byung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar tshogs gnyis dang stong pa nyid bsgoms pa las byung zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is said to arise from the cultivation of the two collections and emptiness.

original: nyon mongs zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / phrag dog dang / log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / phrag dog dang / log par lta ba'o //
translated: Afflictions are desire, hatred, ignorance, pride, jealousy, and wrong views.

original: nye ba zhes pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyi shu ste 'di ltar khro ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / ser sna dang // sgyu dang / g-yo dang / rgyags pa dang / ngo tsha med pa dang /
analyzed: nye ba zhes pa ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyi shu ste 'di ltar khro ba dang / 'khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab pa dang / 'tshig pa dang / ser sna dang // sgyu dang / g-yo dang / rgyags pa dang / ngo tsha med pa dang /
translated: Secondary afflictions are the twenty secondary afflictions: anger, resentment, concealment, spite, stinginess, deceit, fraud, arrogance, shamelessness,

original: khrel med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khrel med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: nonembarrassment, and so on.

original: kun nyon mongs zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
analyzed: kun nyon mongs zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
translated: Afflictive is the afflicted mind.

original: bag chags bcas pa zhes pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags bcas pa zhes pa ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Together with habitual tendencies is the foundation consciousness.

original: gtan spangs pa zhes pa ni de dag las grol ba'o //
analyzed: gtan spangs pa zhes pa ni de dag las grol ba'o //
translated: Completely abandoned is liberation from those.

original: de ltar rang gi don thugs su chud nas 'gro ba'i don du snying rje chen po shes rab ces smos te /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi don thugs su chud nas 'gro ba'i don du snying rje chen po shes rab ces smos te /
translated: Thus, having realized one‚Äôs own aim, for the sake of migrating beings, great compassion is mentioned.

original: snying rje dang shes rab kyi sgo nas don yod par 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje dang shes rab kyi sgo nas don yod par 'gro ba'i don byed pa'o //
translated: Through compassion and wisdom, one benefits beings in a meaningful way.

original: 'du shes kun gyi don spangs shing //
analyzed: 'du shes kun gyi don spangs shing //
translated: Abandoning the meaning of all perceptions,

original: zhes pa ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa las grol ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa las grol ba'o //
translated: means being free from grasping at signs.

original: rnam shes zhes pa ni 'dzin pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam shes zhes pa ni 'dzin pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness refers to the apprehending consciousness.

original: don zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi yul lo //
analyzed: don zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi yul lo //
translated: Meaning refers to the external object.

original: de ltar yul can gyi shes pa las grol bas na 'gog ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar yul can gyi shes pa las grol bas na 'gog ces bya'o //
translated: Since one is free from the apprehending consciousness in that way, it is called ‚Äúcessation.‚Äù

original: sems can kun yid yul dang ldan //
analyzed: sems can kun yid yul dang ldan //
translated: Endowed with the mental objects of all sentient beings,

original: zhes pa ni gdul bya'i shes pa la lha'i skur snang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gdul bya'i shes pa la lha'i skur snang ba'o //
translated: means appearing as the deity‚Äôs form in the consciousness of those to be tamed.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs rigs pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi thugs rigs pa //
translated: The mind of all buddhas,

original: zhes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi don khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi don khong du chud pa'o //
translated: means comprehending the meaning of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: sems can kun gyi yid la gnas //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid la gnas //
translated: Residing in the mind of all sentient beings,

original: zhes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de 'gro ba thams cad kyi rgyud la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de 'gro ba thams cad kyi rgyud la gnas pa'o //
translated: means that nonconceptual wisdom resides in the continuums of all migrating beings.

original: de dag sems dang mthun par 'jug / ces pa ni 'gro ba de dag gi blo'i bye brag gi sgo nas chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: de dag sems dang mthun par 'jug / ces pa ni 'gro ba de dag gi blo'i bye brag gi sgo nas chos ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that the Dharma is taught in accordance with the various mental capacities of those to be trained.

original: sems can kun yid @195a * //üîΩtshim par byed //
analyzed: sems can kun yid @195a * // tshim par byed //
translated: They satisfy the minds of all sentient beings.

original: sems can kun gyi yid dga' ba //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi yid dga' ba //
translated: They delight the minds of all sentient beings.

original: grub pa mthar phyin 'khrul pa med //
analyzed: grub pa mthar phyin 'khrul pa med //
translated: They are accomplished, perfected, and without error.

original: ces pa ni 'gro ba'i don mthar byin pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni 'gro ba'i don mthar byin pa'o //
translated: This shows that they bring the welfare of beings to completion.

original: nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs //
analyzed: nor pa thams cad rnam par spangs //
translated: They have abandoned all error.

original: zhes pa ni log par rtog pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni log par rtog pa spangs pa'o //
translated: This shows that they have abandoned wrong views.

original: don gsum the tshom med pa'i blo //
analyzed: don gsum the tshom med pa'i blo //
translated: They have a mind that is free of doubt regarding the three objects.

original: zhes pa ni dus gsum du yid gnyis dang bral ba'i blo dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dus gsum du yid gnyis dang bral ba'i blo dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This shows that they have a mind free of doubt regarding the three times.

original: kun don zhes pa ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi don byed pa ste /
analyzed: kun don zhes pa ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi don byed pa ste /
translated: They are the meaning of all.

original: grub mthas blo bsgyur ba byang chub sems dpa' man chad nas mu stegs yan chad kyi don byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: grub mthas blo bsgyur ba byang chub sems dpa' man chad nas mu stegs yan chad kyi don byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This shows that they benefit all beings, from bodhisattvas whose minds are transformed by the philosophical tenets up to the tƒ´rthikas.

original: mu stegs kyi don ji ltar byed ce na ;
analyzed: mu stegs kyi don ji ltar byed ce na ;
translated: How do they benefit the tƒ´rthikas?

original: yon tan gsum gyi bdag ces smos te /
analyzed: yon tan gsum gyi bdag ces smos te /
translated: They are the self of the three qualities.

original: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa gsum gyis don byed pa'o //
analyzed: snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa gsum gyis don byed pa'o //
translated: The three are sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: gzhan yang grub mtha' blo 'gyur ba dag gis don yang byed pas na kun don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang grub mtha' blo 'gyur ba dag gis don yang byed pas na kun don zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, since it also performs a function, it is called ‚Äúhaving the purpose of all‚Äù (sarvƒÅrtha).

original: phung po lnga zhes pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga zhes pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The five aggregates are the aggregates of form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: phung po de dag chos gzhan du bzhag nas /
analyzed: phung po de dag chos gzhan du bzhag nas /
translated: When those aggregates are posited as other phenomena,

original: de dag dus gsum gyi chas gzhig na gang yang mi dmigs te rang bzhin med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag dus gsum gyi chas gzhig na gang yang mi dmigs te rang bzhin med par 'gyur ro //
translated: if they are destroyed by the factors of the three times, nothing is observed, and they become essenceless.

original: 'dir rgal ba 'on te dus gsum gyi chas gzhig na skad cig ma yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir rgal ba 'on te dus gsum gyi chas gzhig na skad cig ma yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Here, someone might argue, ‚ÄúBut if they are destroyed by the factors of the three times, then the moment would exist.‚Äù

original: skad cig thams cad bye brag phyed //
analyzed: skad cig thams cad bye brag phyed //
translated: All moments are distinguished.

original: ces bya ba smos te skad cig ma yang dus gsum gyi chas gzhig na med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te skad cig ma yang dus gsum gyi chas gzhig na med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the moment is destroyed by the factors of the three times, it would become nonexistent.

original: dper na rdul phra rab la phyogs kyi nyes pa yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rdul phra rab la phyogs kyi nyes pa yod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the error of direction in the case of a subtle particle.

original: skad cig gcig gis rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: skad cig gcig gis rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: In a single moment, one becomes a perfect buddha.

original: zhes pa ni sa bcu pa nas sa bcu gcig pa'i bar la dus kyi mtha'i skad cig mas rtogs so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sa bcu pa nas sa bcu gcig pa'i bar la dus kyi mtha'i skad cig mas rtogs so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This means that the realization from the tenth to the eleventh stage is by means of the ultimate moment.

original: yang na lha skad cig dran rdzogs kyis bskyed par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na lha skad cig dran rdzogs kyis bskyed par shes par bya'o //
translated: Or else, one should understand that the deity is generated by the instantaneous recollection of the complete form.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin 'chang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi rang bzhin 'chang //
translated: Bearing the nature of all the Buddhas,

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the vajra-like samadhi.üîΩWithout a body,

original: lus med ces pa ni rnam rtog gi lus dang bral ba ste chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: lus med ces pa ni rnam rtog gi lus dang bral ba ste chos kyi sku'o //
translated: means free from the body of conceptualization, which is the dharmakaya.üîΩThe body

original: lus te zhes pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: lus te zhes pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: means the sambhogakaya.üîΩThe supreme body

original: lus kyi mchog ces pa sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: lus kyi mchog ces pa sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: means the nirmanakaya.üîΩThe end

original: mtha' ni rtogs pa po zhes bya ste sku thams cad la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' ni rtogs pa po zhes bya ste sku thams cad la mkhas pa'o //
translated: means the knower, which is the skill in all the kayas.

original: gzugs rnams sna tshogs kun du ston //
analyzed: gzugs rnams sna tshogs kun du ston //
translated: Displaying various forms

original: zhes pa ni gang dang gang gis 'dul ba la de dang de'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gang dang gang gis 'dul ba la de dang de'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba'o //
translated: means that one is disciplined by whatever form is necessary to discipline.üîΩThe jewel crest, the great jewel,

original: nor bu @195b chan por rin chen tog / ces pa ni dgos 'dod 'byung ba'i dpe bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nor bu @195b chan por rin chen tog / ces pa ni dgos 'dod 'byung ba'i dpe bstan pa'o //
translated: means the teaching of the example of the wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyis rtogs bya ba //üîΩzhes pas ni mkhyen par bya ba 'am shis par bya ba ste /üîΩsangs rgyas byang chub bla na med //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyis rtogs bya ba // zhes pas ni mkhyen par bya ba 'am shis par bya ba ste / sangs rgyas byang chub bla na med //
translated: The object of knowledge of all the buddhas.üîΩThe nonabiding nirvana is stated in the line:

original: ces pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The enlightenment of the buddhas is unsurpassed.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of that?üîΩThe line:

original: gsang sngags las byung yi ge med //
analyzed: gsang sngags las byung yi ge med //

original: ces pa lte blo'i yul thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: ces pa lte blo'i yul thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: means that it is free from all objects of the intellect.üîΩSince various magical displays of arising arise from the meaning of nonarising,

original: de lta bu'i skye ba med pa'i don de las skye ba'i cho 'phrul sna tshogs su 'char bas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i skye ba med pa'i don de las skye ba'i cho 'phrul sna tshogs su 'char bas /
translated: the line:

analyzed: gsang sngags chen po rigs gsum pa //

analyzed: zhes smos te sku gsung thugs sna tshogs su shar ba'i don to //

analyzed: gsang sngags don kun skyed pa po //

analyzed: zhes pa ni don kun zhi ba dang / rgyas pa dang / dbang dang / drag po'o //

analyzed: de la zhi ba'i las ni rgyud 'di bris pa 'am /
translated: Pacifying activities are writing this tantra,üîΩholding it,

analyzed: bzung ba'am / bcangs pa 'am /

analyzed: dbang gi las ni gang dang gang 'dod pa de rengs pa dang 'gugs par byed do //

analyzed: las de dag kyang 'khrul 'khor gyi sbyor bas kyang shes par bya'o //

analyzed: mo m'a ra ya phat / aom tr'i: shtvi: wi kri t'a na na h'um phat ces pas bskor ro /

original: de'i rim pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i rim pa ni 'di yin te /

original: bsnyen pa rdzogs pa dang / mnan pa dang / gtub pa dang / spyin sreg la sogs pa ci rigs pa brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen pa rdzogs pa dang / mnan pa dang / gtub pa dang / spyin sreg la sogs pa ci rigs pa brtsam par bya'o //
translated: One should begin the recitation, the consecration, the suppression, the cutting, the burnt offering, and so forth, as appropriate.

original: yang na gsang sngags kyi don de dag thams cad bskyed pa ni ye shes sems dpa' khyod yin bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang na gsang sngags kyi don de dag thams cad bskyed pa ni ye shes sems dpa' khyod yin bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or else, all those meanings of the mantra are generated by you, the gnosis being.

original: thig ni drang po ste don ma nor ba'o //
analyzed: thig ni drang po ste don ma nor ba'o //
translated: Line means straight, that is, unmistaken.

original: le ni kun la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: le ni kun la khyab pa'o //
translated: Chapter means pervading all.

original: stong pa ni rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa ni rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: Emptiness means without intrinsic nature.

original: yi ge ni kun rdzob mtshon pa ste sems can thams cad do //
analyzed: yi ge ni kun rdzob mtshon pa ste sems can thams cad do //
translated: Syllable means the conventional symbol, that is, all sentient beings.

original: rgya zhes pa ni bye brag gam du ma mtshon pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: rgya zhes pa ni bye brag gam du ma mtshon pa'i tshig go //
translated: Seal means a word that symbolizes a particular or many.

original: rnam pa kun ldan zhes pa ni rnam pa mi 'dra ba la bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa kun ldan zhes pa ni rnam pa mi 'dra ba la bya ste /
translated: Endowed with all aspects means different aspects.

original: kun rdzob lha'i 'khor lo thams cad do //
analyzed: kun rdzob lha'i 'khor lo thams cad do //
translated: All aspects means the conventional circle of deities.

original: rnam pa med ces pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa ste lha'i 'khor lo rang bzhin med par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa med ces pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa ste lha'i 'khor lo rang bzhin med par shes pa'o //
translated: Without aspects means the completion stage, knowing the circle of deities to be without intrinsic nature.

original: yang na rnam pa kun zhes pa ni sems tsam rnam pa bden par smra ba'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam pa kun zhes pa ni sems tsam rnam pa bden par smra ba'o //
translated: Or else, all aspects means the CittamƒÅtra proponents of real aspects.

original: rnam pa med ces pa ni rnam pa brdzun par smra ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa med ces pa ni rnam pa brdzun par smra ba'o //
translated: The absence of aspects is the false claim of the absence of aspects.

original: bcu drug ni rtsa 'dab ma bcu drug go //
analyzed: bcu drug ni rtsa 'dab ma bcu drug go //
translated: The sixteen are the sixteen channel petals.

original: phyed ni rtsa 'dab ma brgyad de snying ga'o //
analyzed: phyed ni rtsa 'dab ma brgyad de snying ga'o //
translated: The half is the eight channel petals, which are the heart.

original: phyed gnyis pa ni 'khor lo bzhi'o //
analyzed: phyed gnyis pa ni 'khor lo bzhi'o //
translated: The second half is the four cakras.

original: thig le ni khu ba ste byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: thig le ni khu ba ste byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The bindu is the seminal essence, the bodhicitta.

original: rtsa de dag ni yur ba dang 'dra ste khrag dang zhag dang thig le'i rten byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa de dag ni yur ba dang 'dra ste khrag dang zhag dang thig le'i rten byed pa'o //
translated: Those channels are like canals, serving as the support for blood, marrow, and bindu.

original: thig le de dag gi 'od ni yi ge'i rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thig le de dag gi 'od ni yi ge'i rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: The light of those bindus exists in the form of syllables.

original: de yang re zhig sgrub pa po gshin rje gshed yab yum dang bcas pa'i nga rgyal du zhugs te /
analyzed: de yang re zhig sgrub pa po gshin rje gshed yab yum dang bcas pa'i nga rgyal du zhugs te /
translated: Moreover, the practitioner first enters into the pride of being the father and mother YamƒÅntaka.

original: rtsa'i ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa ni phyi rol gyi lha'i rnam pa /
analyzed: rtsa'i ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa ni phyi rol gyi lha'i rnam pa /
translated: The generation of the concentration of the channels is the external aspect of the deity.

original: nang ni rtsa'i rnam pa ste /üîΩg-yas pa ni ra sa n'a'o //
analyzed: nang ni rtsa'i rnam pa ste / g-yas pa ni ra sa n'a'o //
translated: The internal aspect is the aspect of the channels.üîΩThe right channel is the rasanƒÅ.

original: g-yon pa ni la la na'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa ni la la na'o //
translated: The left channel is the lalanƒÅ.

original: dbus ma ni aa wa dh'u t'i zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbus ma ni aa wa dh'u t'i zhes bya ste /
translated: The central channel is called the avadh≈´ti.

original: de yang mtshan nyid rnam bzhi dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid rnam bzhi dang ldan pa /
translated: That is endowed with four characteristics:üîΩwhite,

original: dkar ba / ser ba /
analyzed: dkar ba / ser ba /
translated: yellow,üîΩred, and black.

original: dmar pa / snum pa /
analyzed: dmar pa / snum pa /
translated: It is red and oily.

original: gnas ni sgal tshigs la brten srog rtsa zhes grags so //
analyzed: gnas ni sgal tshigs la brten srog rtsa zhes grags so //
translated: Its location is based on the spine and is known as the life channel.

original: sbom phra ni 'bras kyi sog ma'i tshad do //
analyzed: sbom phra ni 'bras kyi sog ma'i tshad do //

original: ring thung spyi bo bde ba chen po nas gsang ba'i gnas su sleb pa'o //
analyzed: ring thung spyi bo bde ba chen po nas gsang ba'i gnas su sleb pa'o //
translated: Its length is from the great bliss of the crown to the secret place.

original: rtsa chen po 'di ni dper na chu bo chen po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rtsa chen po 'di ni dper na chu bo chen po dang 'dra ste /
translated: This great channel is like a great river.

original: chu bran thams cad de'i nang du 'du zhing der la bltas pa'o //
analyzed: chu bran thams cad de'i nang du 'du zhing der la bltas pa'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du @196b rtsa thams cad kyang 'di'i nang du 'du zhing 'di la kha bltas pa'o //

original: 'khor lo bzhi'i yang srog shing gi tshul du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo bzhi'i yang srog shing gi tshul du gnas pa'o //
translated: It is located like the central pole of the four cakras.

original: de la 'og rlung bsdams te tsanda l'i rab tu sbar bas aa wa dh'u t'i'i nang du zhugs te /
analyzed: de la 'og rlung bsdams te tsanda l'i rab tu sbar bas aa wa dh'u t'i'i nang du zhugs te /
translated: In that regard, since the lower vƒÅyu is constricted and the ca·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´ fire blazes, it enters inside the avadh≈´ti.

original: sprul ba'i 'khor lo'i rtsa'i nang thams cad bsros pas /
analyzed: sprul ba'i 'khor lo'i rtsa'i nang thams cad bsros pas /
translated: Since it heats the entire inside of the nirmƒÅ·πáacakra,

original: thig le zhun mar gyi tshul du gnas pa de zhu nas /
analyzed: thig le zhun mar gyi tshul du gnas pa de zhu nas /
translated: the bindu, which is like melted butter, melts.

original: gsang ba'i gnas su bde ba 'bar bar bsam /
analyzed: gsang ba'i gnas su bde ba 'bar bar bsam /

original: de nas yang tsanda l'i'i me chen po rab tu 'bar bas /
analyzed: de nas yang tsanda l'i'i me chen po rab tu 'bar bas /

analyzed: snying ga'i chos kyi 'khor lo'i rtsa thams cad rab tu bsros te thig le thams cad rab tu zhu nas bde ba nyams su myong bar bsam mo //

analyzed: de nas yang tsanda l'i rab tu sbar bas mgrin pa longs spyod kyi rtsa thams cad rab tu bsros te /
translated: Then, again, since candali blazes, all the channels of the sambhogacakra at the throat are thoroughly heated,

original: thig le thams cad zhu nas bde ba nyams su myong bar bsam /
analyzed: thig le thams cad zhu nas bde ba nyams su myong bar bsam /
translated: all the bindus melt, and one experiences bliss.

original: de nas tsanda l'i rab tu sbar bas spyi bo bde ba chen po'i rtsa thams cad rab tu bsros te /
analyzed: de nas tsanda l'i rab tu sbar bas spyi bo bde ba chen po'i rtsa thams cad rab tu bsros te /

original: thig le thams cad zhu nas bde ba nyams su myong bar bsam mo //
analyzed: thig le thams cad zhu nas bde ba nyams su myong bar bsam mo //

original: de ltar rtsa rlung thig le rim pa bzhin du nyams su blangs so //
analyzed: de ltar rtsa rlung thig le rim pa bzhin du nyams su blangs so //
translated: Thus, one practices the channels, winds, and bindus in sequence.

original: can zhes pa ldan pa'i tshig ste mngon par shes pa drug dang rdzu 'phrul bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: can zhes pa ldan pa'i tshig ste mngon par shes pa drug dang rdzu 'phrul bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mtshan bcas kyi rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pa'o //

original: yang na bcu drug ni stong pa bcu drug ste yul lo //
analyzed: yang na bcu drug ni stong pa bcu drug ste yul lo //

original: brgyad ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad de yul can no //
analyzed: brgyad ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs brgyad de yul can no //

original: bzhi ni ae wam ma y'a ste 'khor 'das bstan pa'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: bzhi ni ae wam ma y'a ste 'khor 'das bstan pa'i yi ge'o //
translated: The four are e va·πÉ ma ya, the syllables that teach sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: 'di la slob dpon kha cig ni phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi thig gi rim par 'dod pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon kha cig ni phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi thig gi rim par 'dod pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: In this regard, some masters assert that the sixteen are the stages of the lines of the outer ma·πá·∏çala.

original: yan lag med pa'i rtsis las 'das //
analyzed: yan lag med pa'i rtsis las 'das //
translated: It is beyond the enumeration of parts.

original: zhes pa ni spyir rgyud 'di'i bsgom pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni spyir rgyud 'di'i bsgom pa yin te /
translated: This is the general meditation of this tantra.

original: rtsis gdab thams cad dang bral ba ngo bo gang du yang ma grub pa ci la yang bsam du med pa /
analyzed: rtsis gdab thams cad dang bral ba ngo bo gang du yang ma grub pa ci la yang bsam du med pa /
translated: It is free from all enumerations, not established as any essence at all, and not to be thought of as anything.

original: tha snyad dang blo'i chos thams cad las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad dang blo'i chos thams cad las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is beyond all conventions and mental phenomena.

original: de bas na yan lag ni spros pa mtshon pa ste tshig gi tshogs so //
analyzed: de bas na yan lag ni spros pa mtshon pa ste tshig gi tshogs so //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúparts‚Äù indicates proliferation, the collection of words.

original: rtsis las 'das zhes pa ni 'khrul pa zhes pa ste brtags pa'i dngos po nub pa'o //
analyzed: rtsis las 'das zhes pa ni 'khrul pa zhes pa ste brtags pa'i dngos po nub pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBeyond enumeration‚Äù means ‚Äúbeyond delusion,‚Äù the subsiding of imputed things.

original: de lta bu de la mnyam par gzhag pa ni mnyam gzhag chen po'o //
analyzed: de lta bu de la mnyam par gzhag pa ni mnyam gzhag chen po'o //
translated: Such a one is in the great meditative equipoise.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan te dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan te dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth meditation is the mundane meditation, which is the first, second, third, and fourth meditation.üîΩThe one with the peak is superior to those.

original: rtse mo can zhes pa ni de dag las khyad par du gyur pa ste /üîΩgong du smos @197a * //
analyzed: rtse mo can zhes pa ni de dag las khyad par du gyur pa ste / gong du smos @197a * //
translated: The one with the peak is superior to those.

original: pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness mentioned above is the emptiness of the fourth meditation.

original: bsam gtan yan lag kun zhes pa ni dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan yan lag kun zhes pa ni dpa' bar 'gro ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: All the branches of meditation means that it is endowed with the inconceivable concentrations such as the heroic stride.

original: shes shing zhes pa ni rtsis gdab dang bral ba'i don rtogs pa las 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes shing zhes pa ni rtsis gdab dang bral ba'i don rtogs pa las 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Knowing means that it arises from the realization of the meaning free from mental placement.

original: ting 'dzin rig dang zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: ting 'dzin rig dang zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad khong du chud pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of concentration means that it comprehends all concentrations, both mundane and supramundane.

original: rgyud rig pa zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin goms pa'i 'bras bu ste 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud rig pa zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin goms pa'i 'bras bu ste 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems shes pa'o //
translated: The tantra-vidyƒÅ is the result of the practice of samƒÅdhi, which is the knowledge of the minds of all beings.

original: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin sus rtogs pa de la ting 'dzin lus can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin sus rtogs pa de la ting 'dzin lus can zhes bya ste /
translated: One who realizes such a samƒÅdhi is called a samƒÅdhi-deha,

original: dngos su ye shes sems dpa' la ldan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos su ye shes sems dpa' la ldan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: which means that he is endowed with the j√±ƒÅna-sattva.

original: lus kyi mchog ces pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs sku kun gyi rgyal //
analyzed: lus kyi mchog ces pa dang / longs spyod rdzogs sku kun gyi rgyal //
translated: The supreme body, the king of all the sa·πÉbhoga-kƒÅyas,üîΩand the nirmƒÅ·πáa-kƒÅya, the supreme body,

original: zhes pa dang / sprul pa'i sku ste sku yi mchog / ces pa ni rgyud 'di'i 'bras bu ston pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / sprul pa'i sku ste sku yi mchog / ces pa ni rgyud 'di'i 'bras bu ston pa'i tshig ste /
translated: are the words that teach the result of this tantra.

original: de yang sku rnam pa gsum po ni 'bras bu yin pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang sku rnam pa gsum po ni 'bras bu yin pas kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin la /
translated: The three kinds of bodies are the result, and so are the conventional truth.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni dbyer mi phyed pa ste don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni dbyer mi phyed pa ste don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The svabhƒÅva-kƒÅya is indivisible, and so is the ultimate truth.

original: phyogs bcur sprul pa sna tshogs 'gyed //
analyzed: phyogs bcur sprul pa sna tshogs 'gyed //
translated: It sends out various emanations in the ten directions.

original: ces pa ni sprul pa'i sku'i khyad par gyi yon tan no //
analyzed: ces pa ni sprul pa'i sku'i khyad par gyi yon tan no //
translated: This is the special quality of the nirmƒÅ·πáa-kƒÅya.

original: khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan zhe na /

original: ji bzhin 'gro ba'i don byed pa //
analyzed: ji bzhin 'gro ba'i don byed pa //
